intro: Dockrillia, commonly known as the "false dock," is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, slender stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Dockrillia is typically found in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions. It is often used in herbal medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
